title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: I wanted apicture of the Earl of Rothes for the Duke of Buccleuch, a fine SirJoshua, but Balfour of Balbirnie fancied it also, and followed it to 160guineas.

title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance
author: Grant, James
snippet: At Balbirnie there stood an ancient cross,erected by a gentleman of the neighbourhood, who hadslain another at that place; and this cross (which is stdlstanding) Leshe knew would afford him a sanctuary, ifhis pursuers were old cathohcs; but he remembered tbatthe Reformation had made vast progress in Fife, and thatits proselytes would not hesitate to violate any sanctuary; so instead of pressing onward to gain this bonnie,supposing that the direct road might be beset stdlfurther on, he turned abruptly to the left, and plungeddown a narrow strath, which led, as he was aware,towards the viUage of Markinch, and the strong cistleof the Lundies of Balgonie.
